messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] CHAIN LETTER SENDING
messages.msgSnippet: ... Appropriate? No. But the only way to prevent people from sending inappropriate things is for someone to preread every single email before it goes through
messages.messageBody:
on 5/22/03 5:36 PM, Tim and Maureen at tmthomas@... wrote:

> Is it appropriate for religious chain letters to be sent on the unschooling
> list. I for one resent this. I am aware I can just delete this but I thought
> this list was unschooling. I do not want that sent to me!!! Did anyone else
> receive the one sent by Vanessa with the implication that if we don't respond
> it is the work of Satan???? YUCK

Appropriate? No. But the only way to prevent people from sending
inappropriate things is for someone to preread every single email before it
goes through to the list. I can prevent people from *repeatedly* sending
inappropriate things, but they have to send the first one for me to know who
to watch.

It's not something that happens very often.

Joyce
Unschooling-dotcom moderator

messages.subject: CHAIN LETTER SENDING
messages.msgSnippet: Is it appropriate for religious chain letters to be sent on the unschooling list. I for one resent this. I am aware I can just delete this but I thought this
messages.messageBody:
Is it appropriate for religious chain letters to be sent on the unschooling list. I for one resent this. I am aware I can just delete this but I thought this list was unschooling. I do not want that sent to me!!! Did anyone else receive the one sent by Vanessa with the implication that if we don't respond it is the work of Satan???? YUCK

Maureen


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
